gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਗਗਨ ਘਟਾ ਘਮੰਡ ਬਿਲੋਕੀਅਤਿ ਗਰਜਿ ਗਰਜਿ ਬਿਨੁ ਬਰਖਾ ਬਿਲਾਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Gagan Ghataa Ghamand Bilokeeati , Garaji Garaji Binu Barakhaa Bilaat Hai ?
translation: Just as black clouds are often seen in the sky who make thundering sound but disperse without releasing a drop of rain.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਹਿਮਾਚਲਿ ਕਠੋਰ ਅੳੁ ਸੀਤਲ ਅਤਿ ਸਕੀਅੈ ਨ ਖਾੲਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਖਾ ਨ ਮਿਟਾਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Himaachali Katthor Au Seetal Ati , Sakeeai N Khaai Trikhaa N Mitaat Hai ?
translation: Just as a snow clad mountain is very hard and cold; it yields no eatable nor can the thirst be quenched by eating the snow.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਓਸੁ ਪਰਤ ਕਰਤ ਹੈ ਸਜਲ ਦੇਹੀ ਰਾਖੀਅੈ ਚਿਰੰਕਾਲ ਨ ਠੳੁਰ ਠਹਰਾਤਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Aosu Parat Karat Hai Sajal Dayhee , Raakheeai Chirankaal N Tthaur Tthaharaati Hai ?
translation: Just as dew wets the body but it cannot be kept at a place for long. It cannot be stored.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵ ਤ੍ਰਿਬਿਧਿ ਚਪਲ ਫਲ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਪ੍ਵਾਹ ਨਿਸ ਪ੍ਰਾਤ ਹੈ ॥੪੪੬॥
transliteration: Taisay Aan Dayv Sayv Tribidhi Chapal Dhala , Satigur Anmrit Pravaah Nis Praat Hai ?446?
translation: So is the fruit of the service of gods who live life in the three traits of maya. Their reward is also influenced by the three traits of mammon. Only the service of the True Guru maintains the flow of the Naam-Bani elixir for ever.  (446)
